projects.title: Ganjoorjoor
projects.description: A pioneering semantic search engine for classic Persian poetry. It empowers users to discover poems based on their conceptual meaning, bridging a thousand years of rich literary history.
projects.intuition: I have a deep love for Persian literature, but often struggled to recall specific verses. I envisioned a search engine that could find poetry based on the meaning behind the words, not just exact keywords, making this vast literary tradition more accessible to everyone.
roadmap: Download all poems from major poets
Benchmark top-tier embedding models
Generate embeddings for each verse + meaning
Build the vector search engine
Develop and deploy the public website

projects.title: Termustat
projects.description: An online tool that helps university students schedule their academic semesters. Since its launch in 2018, Termustat has efficiently served over 2,000 students across three public universities in Iran.
projects.intuition: During my second year of undergrad, course planning was a frustrating manual task. We had to sift through a large PDF of courses to build a conflict-free schedule by hand. I wanted to create a tool to automate this tedious process entirely.
roadmap: Build the initial course scraper
Develop the course data processor
Create the online scheduling table interface
Deploy the live website

progress.status: Online, currently undergoing a full refactor

projects.title: Take Me Home
projects.description: A tool that leverages chaos theory to find significant price reductions on ride-hailing services. By testing minor variations in pickup and drop-off locations, it exploits the pricing algorithms' sensitivity to initial conditions, often revealing fares up to 50% cheaper.
projects.intuition: While reading about chaos theory, I hypothesized that the complex pricing algorithms of ride-hailing apps would behave as chaotic systems. I tested this by requesting fares from slightly different pickup points and discovered that minor changes could lead to dramatic price differences.
roadmap: Reverse-engineer the price request APIs for Snapp and Tap30
Develop a script to generate random nearby geographic coordinates
Automate fetching and comparing prices from multiple points
Create a function to export the optimal coordinates to the official app

Design and build the hardware prototype
TBD...

projects.title: Digikala & Amazon Rating Laplace
projects.description: A browser extension that enhances Amazon and Digikala by providing more reliable product ratings. It applies Laplace's Rule of Succession to calculate a Laplacian score, helping users make better decisions by balancing high ratings with low review counts.
projects.intuition: I often struggled to choose between products with high ratings from few reviews and those with slightly lower ratings but a large volume of reviews.
roadmap: Research Laplace's Rule of Succession
Develop the core rating calculation logic
Build the browser extension
Port the extension to support Amazon + Digikala

projects.title: Mehrabad FIDS
projects.description: A custom Flight Information Display System (FIDS) built with an ESP32 and an LCD screen. It fetches real-time data to identify the airline, type, and destination of airplanes flying overhead.
projects.intuition: I had a great balcony with a spectacular view over the city, especially the airport runway. When a loved one once wondered where a plane was headed, the idea for this project was born.
roadmap: Learn about ESP32, I2C LCD, and power
Develop Arduino code for WiFi + data fetch
Build a server to query FlightRadar24
Mount the device on the balcony wall

projects.title: Chi Shod Bot
projects.description: A Telegram bot that provides on-demand summaries of group chat conversations. It uses OpenAI's ChatGPT API and a circular buffer for efficient message handling to deliver a quick TLDR for users.
projects.intuition: I noticed friends frequently joining our group chat after a long absence and asking: Chi shod? (Persian for What happened?).
roadmap: Build the core Telegram bot framework
Implement Circular Buffer for message memory
Integrate with OpenAI for summarization
Deploy on a private VPS for active use

projects.title: GeoJSON Indoor Tools
projects.description: A set of specialized Python scripts for editing GeoJSON files, specifically created to handle indoor mapping features like adding walls and doors to building polygons.
projects.intuition: While developing an indoor positioning service, I discovered a lack of tools for detailed GeoJSON editing. Standard software couldn't add architectural features like walls or doors, so I built my own solution to fill that gap.
roadmap: Identify critical missing features
Solve the math of adding walls + doors
Develop and test the core Python scripts
Publish the tools as an open-source package

projects.title: CGOL Twitter
projects.description: A twitter for a Turing-complete computer built entirely within Conway's Game of Life. This complex system is capable of printing predefined messages, such as English letters or pixel art, on its 32x32 virtual display.
projects.intuition: My fascination with Conway's Game of Life peaked when I saw a simulation running within itself, a demonstration of its Turing completeness. This sparked a creative challenge: could I tweet nothing but a word LIFE, and in the same thread, build a computer that literally tweets LIFE?
roadmap: Explore CGOL patterns + universal logic gates
Develop an Assembly code generator
Design the initial Persian LIFE
Generate the final CGOL pattern

projects.title: Digikala Vector Search
projects.description: A proof-of-concept semantic search engine for Digikala, Iran's largest e-commerce platform. This project leverages Elasticsearch and sentence-transformer models to enable product discovery based on the meaning of search queries, not just keywords.
projects.intuition: Frustrated with the keyword-based limitations of Digikala's native search, I saw an opportunity to apply my experience in vector search. The goal was to build a proof-of-concept that could demonstrate the power of semantic understanding in an e-commerce context.
roadmap: Store and analyze all DigiKala products
Generate embeddings
Build a search engine
Test the model and app

projects.title: LinkedIn Job Skills Highlighter
projects.description: A browser extension designed to streamline the job application process by automatically highlighting user-defined keywords and skills within LinkedIn job descriptions.
projects.intuition: Applying for jobs involved a repetitive, manual process: opening a job post, clicking 'show more,' and scanning the entire text for required skills.
roadmap: Analyze the DOM structure of LinkedIn job pages
Develop core logic to inject UI + highlight text
Test across various job posting formats
Package and release as a browser extension

projects.title: Lyrics Video Generator
projects.description: A Python application that generates a unique music video from a user's recent tweets. It uses Google's Gemini to craft lyrics from the tweets and Suno AI to compose and perform an original song.
projects.intuition: Inspired by Martin Scorsese's belief that 'the most personal is the most creative,' I wondered if AI could create art that truly reflects an individual's life.
roadmap: Build user's recent tweets scraper
Engineer prompts for Gemini and Suno AI
Use ffmpeg to combine audio and visuals
Automate the final video export process

projects.title: JobJar.cc
projects.description: An automated job application tracking system. JobJar uses AI to organize, track, and provide detailed insights on applications, allowing job seekers to focus on interviews instead of administration.
projects.intuition: The idea sparked from Gmail's feature of treating dotted email addresses as the same alias. I realized I could use a unique dotted version of my email for job applications, then automatically forward all responses to an AI that would classify and track everything without any manual input.
roadmap: Configure dedicated Gmail and forwarding it
Develop a backend with a mail server
Code the AI classifier for application statuses
Create a dashboard for viewing applications
